block.p: Cindy Elizabeth Diaz, the daughter of Ladys Olavarria of Fort Lauderdale, Fla., and Victor J. Diaz of Woodside, Queens, was married yesterday to John Edward Munter, a son of Rosemary and John Munter of Saratoga Springs, N.Y. The Rev. John Weyand, a Roman Catholic priest, officiated in the boathouse of Great Camp Sagamore, a historic house in Raquette Lake, N.Y.

Mrs. Munter, 25, teaches Spanish at the Burr and Burton Seminary, a high school in Manchester, Vt. She graduated from Skidmore College and is a candidate for a master's degree in Spanish literature at the State University at Albany. Her father is an assistant maintenance-services manager for Hudson General, which maintains aircraft at John F. Kennedy International Airport in Queens. Her mother is a case manager for Broward County Family Court Services in Fort Lauderdale.

Cindy Elizabeth Diaz, the daughter of Ladys Olavarria of Fort Lauderdale, Fla., and Victor J. Diaz of Woodside, Queens, was married yesterday to John Edward Munter, a son of Rosemary and John Munter of Saratoga Springs, N.Y. The Rev. John Weyand, a Roman Catholic priest, officiated in the boathouse of Great Camp Sagamore, a historic house in Raquette Lake, N.Y.

Mrs. Munter, 25, teaches Spanish at the Burr and Burton Seminary, a high school in Manchester, Vt. She graduated from Skidmore College and is a candidate for a master's degree in Spanish literature at the State University at Albany. Her father is an assistant maintenance-services manager for Hudson General, which maintains aircraft at John F. Kennedy International Airport in Queens. Her mother is a case manager for Broward County Family Court Services in Fort Lauderdale.
Mr. Munter, 29, is a project manager for Munter Enterprises, a contractor in Middle Grove, N.Y., of which his father is the president. The bridegroom graduated from Manhattan College.
